text: Creative Construction Company (also referred to as CCC) is a 1975 album by the jazz collective Creative Construction Company, originally released on the Muse label, and later reissued as Muhal on the Italian Vedette label.Muse Records discography accessed March 25, 2015Anthony Braxton discography accessed March 25, 2015Muhal Richard Abrams discography accessed March 25, 2015 ==Reception== Allmusic awarded the album 3 stars.Allmusic listing, accessed March 25, 2015 ==Track listing== All compositions by Leroy Jenkins # "Muhal (Part I)" - 19:24 # "Muhal (Part II)" - 14:40 # "Live Spiral - 2:40 == Personnel == *Anthony Braxton - alto saxophone, soprano saxophone, clarinet, flute, contrabass clarinet, chimes *Leroy Jenkins - violin, viola, recorder, toy xylophone, harmonica, bicycle horn *Leo Smith - trumpet, flugelhorn, French horn, seal horn, percussion *Muhal Richard Abrams - piano, cello, clarinet *Richard Davis - bass *Steve McCall - drums, percussion == References == Category:Creative Construction Company albums Category:Muse Records live albums Category:1975 live albums
title: Creative Construction Company (album)
